answerText: adiabatic[10] The adiabatic index is equal to the ratio of heat capacity at constant pressure and constant volume. What is the adiabatic index of a monatomic ideal gas?
heading: Penn Bowl |2014 | 13 | 19 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Magnetic fields are used in a cooling technique in which the energy is leached out of a magnetic material; that technique is this type of demagnetization. For 10 points each: [10] Name this type of process in which there is no heat transfer. An unrelated theorem from quantum mechanics with this name states that slow perturbations of a system do not change its eigenstate.
